WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The person washing all the dishes was named Sarah (ã•ã‚‰). She was named that because of her large head, which was shaped like Sarah Jessica Parkerâ€™s head (very big).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine someone with a huge head, washing dishes. When I say huge, I mean huge. She turns towards you with her big head and says â€œHi, Iâ€™m Sarahâ€ and you see her name tag, which also says Sarah. She is Sarah, the dish washer. The plates she holds up next to her head pale in comparison, even though they're the biggest pieces.

humanum_full_description_en:
A utensil for holding food like characters. "Shuowen": "The dish is a utensil for meals. Pictogram. Agree with the bean. Every dish belongs to the dish. Read it like a fierce." Xu Kai changed it to "a utensil for eating", which can be followed.

The shape of an oracle bone inscription is like a container. The 27-year-old dish may be added next to the " gold " to indicate that it is made of bronze.

Qiu Xigui proposed that the " pan " in the oracle bone inscriptions would later be called Zun and Ampoules. He believed that from the bronze ware discovered, only the 27-year-old pan in the Warring States Period called himself "[é‡‘ç›˜]". After the Warring States period, there was almost no single word " Sa ", which shows that this kind of artifact has been renamed to other names.

The character " Sa " in the oracle bone inscriptions is pronounced as " Meng " and is used as a place name. "He Ji" 10964: "Tian Yu San" refers to hunting in the field of Meng. "Zuo Zhuan. "The Eleventh Year of Yin Gong": "Xiang, Meng, Zhou, Xing, Huai." The land is in the south of Meng County, Henan Province. In addition, "Compilation" 24892 has the word "Sailing Rain", pronounced "Meng Yu" (Zhao Cheng).

Bronze " pan " is used as the original meaning, twenty-seven years pan: "Twenty-seven years Ning is [é‡‘ Pan]." In addition, " pan " in bronze is mostly used as a person's name, Bo Gui: "Bai (Ber) Zha Zhan Pan Bao Zun Yi ."
humanum_short_description_en: An appliance that holds food like a character.

A utensil for holding food like characters. "Shuowen": "The dish is a utensil for meals. Pictogram. Agree with the bean. Every dish belongs to the dish. Read it like a fierce." Xu Kai changed it to "a utensil for eating", which can be followed. The shape of an oracle bone inscription is like a container. The 27-year-old dish may be added next to the " gold" to indicate that it is made of bronze. Qiu Xigui proposed that the " pan" in the oracle bone inscriptions would later be called Zun and Ampoules. He believed that from the bronze ware discovered, only the 27-year-old pan in the Warring States Period called himself "[é‡‘ç›˜]". After the Warring States period, there was almost no single word " Sa", which shows that this kind of artifact has been renamed to other names. The character " Sa" in the oracle bone inscriptions is pronounced as " Meng" and is used as a place name. "He Ji" 10964: "Tian Yu San" refers to hunting in the field of Meng. "Zuo Zhuan. "The Eleventh Year of Yin Gong": "Xiang, Meng, Zhou, Xing, Huai." The land is in the south of Meng County, Henan Province. In addition, "Compilation" 24892 has the word "Sailing Rain", pronounced "Meng Yu" (Zhao Cheng). Bronze " pan" is used as the original meaning, twenty-seven years pan: "Twenty-seven years Ning is [é‡‘ Pan]." In addition, " pan" in bronze is mostly used as a person's name, Bo Gui: "Bai (Ber) Zha Zhan Pan Bao Zun Yi ."

Radicals: çš¿  (plate)
Meaning Mnemonic
The plate kanji and the plate are exactly the same, like two matching pieces of china.
If you know your radicals, you know your kanji too.
Reading Mnemonic
The person washing all the dishes was named Sarah (ã•ã‚‰). She was named that because of her large head, which was shaped like Sarah Jessica Parkerâ€™s head (very big).
Imagine someone with a huge head, washing dishes. When I say huge, I mean huge. She turns towards you with her big head and says â€œHi, Iâ€™m Sarahâ€ and you see her name tag, which also says Sarah. She is Sarah, the dish washer. The plates she holds up next to her head pale in comparison, even though they're the biggest pieces.
